title: Man City need Champions League win to have successful season - Wright
description: Manchester City have to win this year's Champions League to have had a successful season, says former England striker Ian Wright.

title: Lesbos: Tear gas fired as migrants hold protest over conditions
description: Greek police attempted to break up angry protests over conditions for migrants on the Greek island.

title: Ukraine MP's advice to sell dog to pay bills causes outcry
description: A Ukrainian politician told pensioner to consider selling her pet if she couldn't pay utility bills.

title: Tony Parkes: Blackburn Rovers legend reveals Alzheimer's diagnosis
description: Tony Parkes's daughter says all of his memories of his decades at Blackburn Rovers have gone.

title: Coronavirus: British Chinese people reveal prejudice amid outbreak
description: Chinatown is "quiet" and British Chinese people report racist abuse following the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Streatham attack: Police search homes as attacker Sudesh Amman named
description: Two buildings are searched as it emerges attacker Sudesh Amman was released from prison last month.

title: Brexit: Boris Johnson sets out vision of UK-EU trade deal
description: The PM says there is "no need" for Britain to follow Brussels-made rules to secure the new pact.

title: Coronavirus: One Briton 'fell ill' during Wuhan evacuation flight
description: The Britons evacuated from the coronavirus-hit Chinese city on Sunday are put in separate isolation.

title: 'Showtime' Mahomes provides perfect finish to Super Bowl week
description: Patrick 'Showtime' Mahomes provides the perfect finish to Super Bowl week as he leads the Kansas City Chiefs to a first title in 50 years and cement his position on the world stage.

title: Nearly one million miss tax return deadline
description: Anyone with a genuine excuse for missing Friday night's cut-off can talk to HMRC to avoid fines.

title: Ellie Gould: Murdered girl's friends call for self-defence lessons
description: Ellie Gould's friends and mother are campaigning for self-defence lessons to be taught in schools.

title: Coronavirus: China accuses US of causing panic and 'spreading fear'
description: The US is denying entry to all foreign nationals who have visited China in the past two weeks.

title: Southeastern: 'My three weeks of hell working on the railway'
description: A train manager thrown through a door by a passenger tells how staff are getting mental health help.

title: Streatham attack: Eyewitnesses tell of distress and panic
description: Eyewitnesses describe scenes of panic during the attack in Streatham, London, on Sunday.

title: Bafta Awards 2020: Joaquin Phoenix praised for calling out 'systemic racism'
description: Viola Davis and director Lulu Wang are among those to applaud the actor for his acceptance speech.

title: Shaun Wane: Former Wigan boss appointed England head coach
description: Shaun Wane is appointed England rugby league head coach on a two-year deal, replacing Wayne Bennett.

title: England in South Africa: The issues facing England at start of new ODI cycle
description: England play their first 50-over match since winning the World Cup. What shape are they are in and how will the team look in 2023?

title: The Papers: 'Terror returns to London' and 'freed for rampage'
description: Monday's papers report more details following the terror attack on a south London high street.

title: Bafta Film Awards 2020: 10 things we learned at the ceremony
description: From comments on diversity to claws out for Cats - what really went on at the Baftas?

title: Super Bowl 2020: Kansas City Chiefs stage stunning comeback to beat San Francisco 49ers
description: Patrick Mahomes and the Kansas City Chiefs stage a stunning comeback, scoring 21 points in the fourth quarter, to beat the San Francisco 49ers 31-20 at Super Bowl 54 in Miami.

title: Jennifer Lopez and Shakira sparkle at the Super Bowl
description: The Latin stars bring spectacle back to the half-time show after two lacklustre years.

title: Clowning around: A show that tackles death and grief
description: Liverpudlian theatre company 'Ugly Bucket' have created a performance incorporating people’s experiences of grief.

title: Mercenary 'Mad Mike' Hoare dies aged 100
description: Mike Hoare, a controversial figure, became internationally famous for his campaigns in the Congo.

title: Tarantula YouTube videos help woman beat fear of spiders
description: Vanessa Woods spent years being scared of spiders, but now shares her bedroom with some whoppers.

title: Blood on the tracks: Russian mystery of drummer's death in Siberia
description: Dmitry Fyodorov was an aspiring drummer, but he was accused of selling drugs and then found dead.

title: The medieval knight who went into space
description: Multimillionaire computer games veteran Richard Garriott is also a pioneer of space tourism.

title: 'My overdraft cost will nearly double - why am I being punished?'
description: Big banks have recently announced much higher interest rates for overdrafts, leaving savers confused.

title: Cycling through Europe's deadliest air
description: Serbia has been named as the country with the highest rate of pollution-related deaths in Europe.

title: Michael Barrymore pool death: Police made 'crime scene mistakes'
description: Stuart Lubbock's body was found in Michael Barrymore's swimming pool in March 2001.

title: Secret filming shows drivers filling up with red diesel
description: A BBC investigation found drivers illegally filling tanks with the cheap fuel meant for tractors.

title: 'I sold my hair for $2 to feed my children'
description: Prema Selvam was pushed to the brink of suicide after struggling to feed her family.

title: Newcastle University films grey seals clapping underwater
description: Dr Ben Burville spent 17 years trying to become the first person to record them making the noise.
